newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: India buys Jul kero cargo from Kuwait, +10 cts fob.
newsitem.headline: India buys Jul kero cargo from Kuwait, +10 cts fob.

text.p: State-owned Indian Oil Corp (IOC) has bought one cargo of superior kerosene from Kuwait Petroleum Corp (KPC) in its tender for July delivery at 10 cents per barrel above MidEast spot quotes, on a free-on-board (fob) basis, traders said on Monday.
The cargo is 40,000-45,000 tonnes in size.
The next best offer was made by Dutch trader Vitol, traders said.

Traders had initially thought that IOC would buy the KPC cargo based on its offer of around $1.60 per barrel premium to MidEast spot quotes, on a cost-and-freight (c-and-f) basis to the Indian east coast.
The tender closed on June 5 and was valid until June 6.
IOC cancelled its previous tender for June delivery.

In its tender for May deliveries, India bought 90,000 tonnes of kerosene in two cargoes from Mediterranean trader BB Energy and European major Shell, both at a premium of $34.84 per tonne to Mediterranean spot quotes, c-and-f east coast.
